cab.content: (THIS WCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)CAB I. .N- E T.SECRET. CP. 3485KING FEISAL &: THE FRgjCH TREATY 171TH ANGORA. (Circulated by the Secretary of State for the Colonies.)Paraphrase telegram from the High Commissioner of Iraq, to tho Secretary of State for the Colonies. (Bated ISth November. Received Colonial Office 9.45 p.m. 18th November 1921),No.66VNews of Trench Treaty with Angora has caused a good deal of alarm to Feisal-and all intelligent Iraqies here except pro Turkish elements. In a letter to me td-day Peisal recalls that he repeatedly warned His Majesty's Government when in -London of danger involved to Iraq in conclusion of such a - treaty which was even then rumoured. Now that it has come about he points out emphatically menace involved and impetus which the Treaty is sure to give to Turkish aims ana propaganda against Iraq, and presses'urgently for a-definite pro-pronouncement of. policy of. His Majesty's Government and a clear reply onpreblem of defence already referred to you.I do my best of course to discourage, premature apprehension but we cannot wonder at their uneasiness-I therefore beg to: be kept as fully informed as is prac-ticable of developments as regards Treaty question and to be favoured' at earliest possible moment with decision of His Majesty's Government in the matter of Military r e sp ons i b i 1 i ty... CpX.
